revised_title: Surface Potential Measurements in Hydrogen-Oxygen Reaction on Platinum Films
tldr: The authors conducted surface potential measurements to study the hydrogen-oxygen reaction on platinum films. They discovered a sequence of reaction steps and proposed a reaction scheme involving the formation of transient surface complexes. The findings provide insights into the mechanism of the reaction and help explain the lack of stoichiometry in hydrogen-oxygen titrations and the apparent lack of correlation with infrared spectrometric results.
